_A_SPINNER_COMPONENT_DESCRIPTION_: The ASpinner component is used to display a loading indicator. It supports customizable aria-label attributes for improved accessibility, as well as the ability to safely display HTML content and customize the tag used for rendering.
_A_SPINNER_GROUP_ARIA_LABEL_DESCRIPTION_: This example shows how to use the aria-label with additional parameters from extra in the ASpinner component. The example dynamically adds a number from the extra object to the aria-label text to provide a more precise description for users with special needs. In this case, the aria-label text will change to 'Loading 1', where {{ number }} is taken from the passed object.
_A_SPINNER_GROUP_COLORS_DESCRIPTION_: This example shows how to use various colors for the ASpinner component. You can apply different CSS classes, such as a_color_black, a_color_danger, or a_color_primary, to change the spinner's color. Standard colors like primary, success, and warning are available, as well as various shades of gray and text colors.
_A_SPINNER_GROUP_SIZES_DESCRIPTION_: This example shows how to use different sizes for the ASpinner component. The component supports three sizes: small, medium (default), and large. The size is set using the appropriate CSS class, such as a_spinner_small for a small spinner and a_spinner_large for a large one. The medium size is displayed by default.
_A_SPINNER_PROPS_ARIA_LABEL_DESCRIPTION_: The aria-label attribute for improving accessibility. It can specify separate text for mobile and desktop devices or pass a string for all devices.
_A_SPINNER_PROPS_SAFE_HTML_DESCRIPTION_: Safe HTML content to be displayed inside the loading spinner. Used to customize the spinner's inner content.
_A_SPINNER_PROPS_TAG_DESCRIPTION_: The HTML tag used for rendering the loading spinner. By default, it is span, but it can be changed to any other appropriate tag.
